stream_context.summary: Kaze live-tests a large Blender update from Biobak, integrating a complete visual and structural overhaul of Course 5 (the Ghost Ship) while briefly showing the western saloon level.  Most of the session is spent reading Biobak’s in-file changelog, tweaking textures, combiners, render layers, and collision, and hunting down a crash caused by outdated texture-animation code after the level geometry was shifted upward.

development_findings.summary: Biobak’s Ghost Ship rework (≈1,700 triangles) adds new textures, lighting, railings, anchor, shredded sails, cannon ports, seaweed, treasure room, captain’s quarters, and many structural tweaks; Kaze must update collisions, cut-scene splines, doors, and texture animations to match.
development_findings.quote: First of all, dude, this is fucking sick looking... Updated geo all around the ship; collision mostly the same.

development_findings.summary: Plank at the ship’s prow will become a bouncy ‘diving board’ that can launch Mario to a rope shortcut and may hide a Yoshi coin.
development_findings.quote: Add a bouncy diving board—maybe it has a Yoshi coin if you ground-pound on it and jump very high.

development_findings.summary: Western town jail cell will gradually fill with outlaws as the player collects stars, providing visual progress feedback.
development_findings.quote: Every time you catch an outlaw the outlaw will be in here, so this jail cell slowly fills up as you collect stars.

development_findings.summary: NPC count in the saloon is intentionally low to avoid N64 lag and because writing unique, relevant text for many characters is difficult.
development_findings.quote: Who wants to talk to this many NPCs… more importantly, it's gonna suck.

development_findings.summary: Clear-color fill is disabled to save ~3 ms (≈10 % of frame budget). Performance decisions frequently trump visual niceties.
development_findings.quote: Applying the clear color takes around three milliseconds… so doing a clear color is gonna be very very expensive on N64.

development_findings.summary: Kaze explains texture-format rules: CI textures can’t be mixed in multi-cycle combiners; transparent sails need two-cycle; lightning requires subtracting environment color.  He rewrites several material settings during stream.
A crash after import traced to outdated ‘detect channels’ texture-animation code that referenced moved geometry; removing the animations stopped the matrix-underflow error.
development_findings.quote: It was detect channels… we need to remake the texture animations.

development_findings.summary: Engine and full source will be made public when the hack releases; not before, to avoid leaks.
development_findings.quote: When I release this hack my engine will be public—I'll make the hack open source… at the same time.

development_findings.summary: Skybox/sea transition plan: fade skybox bottom into a color, fade outer sea ring into same color, and render skybox in view space for the ghost-ship level.
Library room puzzle revised: red, scratched bookshelf (with coin marker & floor scuffs) must be pushed; Kaze plans to make it protrude slightly for clearer hint.
Switch that formerly spawned timed blocks will instead open exterior door; Kaze debates timed vs. untimed and considers camera cut to show door or a peephole window.
Coins rendered incorrectly and caused additional crashes; Kaze converts texture to IA8 and fixes combiner, noting vertex-color vs. lighting limitations.
ChatGPT use is minimal—only to look up API names; no use in Mario project.

context_findings.summary: Kaze distrusts captchas and Windows 11 ("spyware"), would still use Windows 7 if viable.
context_findings.quote: I don't need even more spyware—I would still be using Windows 7 if it was a viable option.

context_findings.summary: Design philosophy: every NPC line should matter; avoids filler and respects player time.
Performance-first mindset: willingly drops effects (clear color, extra NPCs) if they cost frames on real hardware.
Open-source ethos balanced with fear of premature leaks; intends simultaneous engine & game release.
Humorous cynicism about programmer productivity: claims many salaried programmers do very little actual work.
context_findings.quote: I think programmers in a 35-hour work week, they just work 10 hours… programmers are the laziest people on the planet.

biobak.summary: Delivered exhaustive Ghost Ship overhaul with embedded changelog; actively discusses texture formats, skybox ideas, coin placement, and visual polish with Kaze.
Requests feedback on UV issues and material settings; accepts Kaze’s on-stream combiners fixes.

badub.summary: Submitted a saloon theme that Kaze found too upbeat and similar to the earlier zoo track; Badub agreed and is rewriting it.

key_stories.title: The Ghost Ship Makeover
key_stories.summary: A three-year-old level is visually outdated.  Biobak delivers a massive Blender update; Kaze must reconcile the art with N64 limits, fix crashes, and keep original gameplay intact.
key_stories.challenge: Integrate a 1,700-triangle rework without breaking performance or existing scripts.
key_stories.process: Read embedded changelog live, adjust layers, convert textures, rewrite combiners, update collisions, and debug a matrix-underflow crash caused by old texture-animation code.
key_stories.outcome: Level now compiles and runs; list of follow-up tasks (lighting, skybox fade, Yoshi coins, cut-scenes) created for the coming week.
key_stories.key_quote: First of all, dude, this is fucking sick looking—but I never import right away anyway.

key_stories.title: Saloon Music Mismatch
key_stories.summary: Badub turned in a western saloon track, but its cheerful tone clashes with the bar’s dark, dusty vibe.  The two quickly realign on mood.
key_stories.challenge: Find a musical identity for the saloon that fits the level’s atmosphere.
key_stories.process: Kaze plays the draft, compares it to an older zoo tune, and requests something moodier; Badub agrees to revise.
key_stories.outcome: Track sent back for revision; Kaze supplies reference to nail the intended feel.
key_stories.key_quote: Too upbeat and happy, I find too… he says he's changing it.

key_stories.title: Hunting the Matrix-Underflow Crash
key_stories.summary: After import the game hard-crashes.  Kaze methodically removes object types until the culprit—out-of-date texture-animation channels—is revealed.
key_stories.challenge: Mysterious crash on level load with no obvious cause.
key_stories.process: Binary-style removal of object categories, use of debugging emulator, identification of ‘detect channels’ relying on moved vertices.
key_stories.outcome: Crash fixed by disabling obsolete animations; new animations will be rebuilt.
key_stories.key_quote: It was detect channels… we need to remake the texture animations.
